author: David Stidham
comment: The watch faces look great, and I wish I could keep using it. But even with the frame rate set on clumsy my watch usually dies before the end of the day. Way too much of a battery hog for me.
title: Huge battery drain

author: Robin Harris
comment: How do I get it to be low bit (black and white)? I have a g watch r and need it to have none of the gray background when inactive. The images show this in the play store, so I bought it, but how do I get it into this mode?!
title: Looks great but...

author: Patryk Pattus
comment: Good looks. Would be perfect if you somehow could add status bar info, and show time changing in seconds when screej is on. Would make me very happy!
title: Great

author: Conner Kasten
comment: Really beatutiful watchface. I've been hunting for watches that really capture the Material Design asthetic, this is one of the best I've found so far.  Would love to see more options in display features (like date time formatting, etc).

author: Marc Brown
comment: Looks great and all, but it's a battery killer.
title: Battery drain

author: Daniel Ashmore
comment: Great app.. Worth the money. Would be awesome if the ripple lasted 60 seconds so it could be used as a Minuite hand. I think it lasts 30 seconds at the moment.

reply.author: Luigi Notaro
reply.content:
Hi Daniel, thanks for your feedback!
You are right: the seconds ripple lasts 30 seconds. I'll keep in mind to add a customization option to personalize this time lapse.

title: Beautiful

author: Anthony De Luca
comment: Fantastic watch face, very clean! Feature request: please add the ability to view watch battery % remaining. Thanks!
title: Brilliant

author: Rory E
comment: Certified battery destroyer. Shortened my battery by around 8 hours
title: HUGE battery hog, even after update

author: Shai Pal
comment: I would report back on battery life soon

reply.author: Luigi Notaro
reply.content: Hi Pal, thanks for your feedback! A new release of Bold Watch Face is available and it's shipping a updated handheld companion app with a brand new "Performance" panel; from here you can change your watch face Frame Rate to Normal, Acceptable or Clumsy to save battery life. Enjoy!

title: Very pretty

author: Brian Ong
comment: Looks good but shows am when its pm. No problems with my default watch face on this. First gen lg gwatch.. Changed to four stars since its fixed but new battery drain issue

reply.author: Luigi Notaro
reply.content: Hi Brian, thanks for your feedback! A new release of Bold Watch Face is available and it's shipping a updated handheld companion app with a brand new "Performance" panel; from here you can change your watch face Frame Rate to Normal, Acceptable or Clumsy to save battery life. Enjoy!

author: Jorge Wiegand
comment: But drains very fast the battery on my LG G Watch.

reply.author: Luigi Notaro
reply.content: Hi Jorge, thanks for your feedback! A new release of Bold Watch Face is available and it's shipping a updated handheld companion app with a brand new "Performance" panel; from here you can change your watch face Frame Rate to Normal, Acceptable or Clumsy to save battery life. Enjoy!

title: WARNING. Battery hog.

author: Pui Soon
comment: Drain battery very fast

reply.author: Luigi Notaro
reply.content: Hi Pui, thanks for your feedback! A new release of Bold Watch Face is available and it's shipping a updated handheld companion app with a brand new "Performance" panel; from here you can change your watch face Frame Rate to Normal, Acceptable or Clumsy to save battery life. Enjoy!

author: Aaron Berlin
comment: Gorgeous!

author: Christian Gaetano
comment: Awesome job, I really like the look and design of this face! It seems the AM/PM issue has been fixed and the analog face is now there too. Really great looking watch face.

reply.author: Luigi Notaro
reply.content: Hello Christian, thanks for your feedback! A new version of Bold is available and is shipping both an analog watch face and a fix for the am/pm indicator. Enjoy!

title: Beautiful

author: Jordan Smith
comment: Bought the face a day ago and I love it. One problem... It killed the battery on my watch in a manner of about 12 hours. Normally I get two full days of use out of my LG G Watch. I'm sure its a bug that can be ironed out. Definitely 5 stars if the bug can be fixed.

reply.author: Luigi Notaro
reply.content: Hi Jordan, thanks for your feedback! A new release of Bold Watch Face is available and it's shipping a updated handheld companion app with a brand new "Performance" panel; from here you can change your watch face Frame Rate to Normal, Acceptable or Clumsy to save battery life. Enjoy!

title: Beautiful but...

author: Jean-François Simard
comment: Wow this looks really great! Only little gripe is the notification preview disappears in dimming mode, which I'd love to still see. However, it won't prevent me from using it.
title: Super looks!

author: Zachary Haddenham
comment: I love the active screen for this watch face. The color combination options are great, and it has an awesome feel to it. I'd love to see the alway-on face remove some of the extras though, and provide just a basic thin representation of the time that won't take too much power on my OLED screen, or burn those pixels out more quickly than the others.

reply.author: Luigi Notaro
reply.content:
Hello Zachary, thanks for your feedback!
A new release of Bold Watch Face is live on Google Play and it now has full support for Ambient mode on OLED screens. Enjoy!

title: Nice start!

author: RIC RUDKIN
comment: It makes a change from all the dark watch faces I'm using. I'm sure updates will bring more customisation so I'm not going to drop many stars for that. Bring it on!!
title: Good start

author: Shawn D
comment: I'm using it on my Moto 360 for now. Looks really nice, and I love all the different color combinations. I'd love to see the option for an analog face as well.

reply.author: Luigi Notaro
reply.content: Hi Shawn, I hope you'll enjoy the analog watch face on the latest update!

title: Pretty cool!

author: Chris Brigolin
comment: Watch dies in about 10 hours when I used to last 30

reply.author: Luigi Notaro
reply.content: Hello Chris, thanks for your feedback! A new release of Bold Watch Face is available and it's shipping a updated handheld companion app with a brand new "Performance" panel; from here you can change your watch face Frame Rate to Normal, Acceptable or Clumsy to save battery life. Enjoy!

title: Kills battery

author: Adam Thomas
comment: Needs more ability to customize... More colors, watch hands vs. numbers, change more than just the front and accent color...etc
title: Nice, but..

author: Dominic Alvarado
comment: Great looking watch face, but I'm hoping that more colors will be available in the future.
title: Looks great!

author: Caleb Lee
comment: Pretty good! it'd be even better if the design could be made to blend in with the Moto 360s 'flat tire'

author: Hernán Rosario
comment: Can you add 12 hour time?

reply.author: Luigi Notaro
reply.content:
Hi Hernán!
Actually the support for 12 hours is already here! If your phone is on 12h the watch should be so too :)

title: Time

author: Kit McLean
comment: Absolutely hammers my moto360 battery. Since I got the moto I've always got 30-40% battery left when I go to bed. The last two nights my watch has died at 9pm. It's the only app I've changed so it must be the culprit!

reply.author: Luigi Notaro
reply.content: Hi Kit, thanks for your feedback! A new release of Bold Watch Face is available and it's shipping a updated handheld companion app with a brand new "Performance" panel; from here you can change your watch face Frame Rate to Normal, Acceptable or Clumsy to save battery life. Enjoy!

title: Great looking, but...

author: Eder Bastos
comment: -Horrific effect on battery -Having the background represent seconds is a neat effect, but keeping it visible in the dim-screen mode doesn't really make sense, because that doesn't get updated every second.  I bet these problems are related.

reply.author: Luigi Notaro
reply.content:
Hi Eder,
Thanks for your feedback. The secondd ripple is drawed on the dim screen for esthetic reasons: the time "freeze" and the ink too. 
A new release is available and it's shipping a updated handheld app with a new Performance panel; from here you can change your watch face Frame Rate to Normal, Acceptable or Clumsy to save battery life. Enjoy!

title: Really nice looks, but...

comment: There seems to be a huge battery drain with this. Maybe I'm doing something wrong...?

reply.author: Luigi Notaro
reply.content: Some devices (like the moto360) do not work well with animated watch faces and Ambient mode on - especially when constantly moving like driving;  otherwise, I didn't noticed any battery drain. Can you maybe help me understand the scenario? knowing what device is used would be great, thanks!

title: Looks Great but...

author: Arik Licholat
comment: And hour markers wouldn't hurt.
title: Needs some color variety.

author: Dinico Win
comment: Clean
title: Better
